text:
Has anyone noticed a real deterioration in the quality of the BF GPS stream over the last few weeks? I always get the RRC dropouts intermittently, but the last few weeks it has been pretty severe. I've attached a sample of yesterday's penultimate Lingfield race - it's a speed plot formed by polyline so the flat lines in the middle represent a total dropout of RRC message on the feed. I've verified the gap on other apps that were running at the same time but sometimes I get these gaps that don't match. I've raised it with Neil before but BF can't find anything wrong.
Just as a sanity check, does ANYONE else get this kind of dropout ? I've asked before but it is really driving me up the wall as I am convinced it is not an issue my end.

elements.text:

text: Thanks chaps. At least that explains this one. I had this one from Bath (final race Friday at Bath Market ID :  1.229665871). Apps running on the SAME server - one has all the data, the other missing large chunks. If I had hair left I'd have pulled it out. On the bot with gaps I get the RPC messages but just blanket dropout on the RRCs. I won't even ask what you have as I clearly get all the data on ONE app but not the other. Genuinely don't understand how it happens.

elements.text: Thanks chaps. At least that explains this one. I had this one from Bath (final race Friday at Bath Market ID :  1.229665871). Apps running on the SAME server - one has all the data, the other missing large chunks. If I had hair left I'd have pulled it out. On the bot with gaps I get the RPC messages but just blanket dropout on the RRCs. I won't even ask what you have as I clearly get all the data on ONE app but not the other. Genuinely don't understand how it happens.

text: I assume you are not getting any conflation / I can’t actually remember if they conflate this stream

text: Not that I can see from logs - plus the RPC messages don't dropout, just the RRC onces. It's like someone flicks a switch. As well as parsing the messages I dump the raw bytes to a file and examine after. It is literally the case that these RRC messages don't arrive for X seconds - sometimes over 20 seconds and it effectively wipes out placing bets on the entire race. Bizarrely it seems worse on GB tracks than the US tracks.

elements.text: Not that I can see from logs - plus the RPC messages don't dropout, just the RRC onces. It's like someone flicks a switch. As well as parsing the messages I dump the raw bytes to a file and examine after. It is literally the case that these RRC messages don't arrive for X seconds - sometimes over 20 seconds and it effectively wipes out placing bets on the entire race. Bizarrely it seems worse on GB tracks than the US tracks.

text: If I had a bottleneck reading off the socket I would still be reading these messages stacked up on the queue. They simply stop arriving. It's odd.

elements.text: If I had a bottleneck reading off the socket I would still be reading these messages stacked up on the queue. They simply stop arriving. It's odd.

text: If you weren’t reading fast enough Betfair would conflate but I am not sure if they do on this stream

text: I get a conflate flag occasionally on the price stream but I've never received on on the GPS tream (just checked over last month of data). Even if there was a conflate flag, I would just get multiple updates within the same message though woudn't I ? I thought that was what the conflate flag was - you're not keeping up with the messages as they come so you get messages with multiple updates over the lagged time?

elements.text: I get a conflate flag occasionally on the price stream but I've never received on on the GPS tream (just checked over last month of data). Even if there was a conflate flag, I would just get multiple updates within the same message though woudn't I ? I thought that was what the conflate flag was - you're not keeping up with the messages as they come so you get messages with multiple updates over the lagged time?

text: No, you would get a single update ‘conflated’

elements.text: No, you would get a single update ‘conflated’

text: Yeah sorry that is what I meant - one lump with indistinguishable updates.

text: I'm definitely not asking for conflation - I know for sure because when I first started using the stream I only asked for 250ms conflated updates

text:
But FWIW this is what I send
`{"op":"raceSubscription","id":10,"heartbeatMs":2000}`

text: Hmm, fairly sure mine will be the same but not sure about the heartbeat value

text: Yeah not sure that there is a "right" value for it. Seems to work ok though for resetting the stream when it locks up. Don't want to be without data for too long.
